Description: Wall sherd of Attic, probably black-figured pottery Gordion cup; interior: part of tondo border with short, alternating red and black tongues, divided by relief lines and added white dot; to the inside, three narrow bands, two rows of staggered dots divided by dilute brown band and two bands; exterior glazed.
Curator's comments: The sherd belongs to the same vase as British Museum 1948,0815.11.
Bibliographic references: Robertson 1951 / Gordion cups from Naukratis (p. 148, no. 11)
Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 384, no. B544)
Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p. 232, no. 11)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0424) (Phase 1)
